geometry::strategy::distance::haversine

geometry::strategy::distance::haversine< P1, P2 > Class Template Reference

Distance calculation for spherical coordinates on a perfect sphere using haversine. More...

Detailed Description

template<typename P1, typename P2 = P1>
class geometry::strategy::distance::haversine< P1, P2 >

Distance calculation for spherical coordinates on a perfect sphere using haversine.

Template parameters:
  • P1 first point type
  • P2 optional second point type
Author:
Adapted from: http://williams.best.vwh.net/avform.htm
Note:
See also http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great-circle_distance

It says: The great circle distance d between two points with coordinates {lat1,lon1} and {lat2,lon2} is given by: d=acos(sin(lat1)*sin(lat2)+cos(lat1)*cos(lat2)*cos(lon1-lon2)) A mathematically equivalent formula, which is less subject to rounding error for short distances is: d=2*asin(sqrt((sin((lat1-lat2)/2))^2 + cos(lat1)*cos(lat2)*(sin((lon1-lon2)/2))^2))

Examples:

5_distance_example.cpp.
